alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Warren (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:26PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of De Kalb, southeastern Rutherford, northern Warren, northern Coffee and Cannon Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 426 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Smithville to 10 miles southwest of Woodbury. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, McMinnville, Smithville, Woodbury, Walterhill, Morrison, Dowelltown, Liberty, Auburntown, Centertown, Lascassas, Beechgrove, Center Hill Lake, Bradyville, Edgar Evans State Park, Milton and Readyville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 between mile markers 74 and 96, and between mile markers 99 and 102. Interstate 840 between mile markers 53 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
